key.name: max_bug_attachment_size
key.description: Maximum size of bug attachments in bytes. A value of 0 means no limit.

key.name: db_statement_timeout
key.description: SQL statement timeout in milliseconds. If a statement takes longer than this to execute, then it will be aborted. A value of 0 turns off the timeout. If this value is not set, PostgreSQL's default setting is used.

sectiontype.name: gina_target
sectiontype.description: Gina will run against the target specified on the command line.

key.name: distro
key.description: The distribution name (e.g. ubuntu) from where the packages will be taken and to where they will be imported into launchpad. A distribution with name DISTRO must be created on launchpad before been used because gina is not able to create distributions.

key.name: distrorelease
key.description: The distrorelease name (e.g. hoary) from where the packages will be taken and to where they will be imported (published) into launchpad. A distrorelease with name DISTRORELEASE inside the distrobution DISTRO must be created on launchpad before been used because gina is not able to create distroreleases.

key.name: architectures
key.description: A comma separated list with the architectures that should be imported into Launchpad. DistroArchRelease entries for this architectures having the architecturetag equal to each element in ARCHS should be created previously for the given DISTRORELEASE.

key.name: components
key.description: A comma separated list with the component names that should be imported into launchpad. As well as in distribution and distrorelease the components must already exists inside launchpad. Currently the componentselection table is not checked but ideally it too should be populated.

key.name: keyrings
key.description: A full path to where the keyrings files are available. These keyrings are used to look up who signed what wherever possible.

key.name: root
key.description: ROOT is the full path to a debian-style archive from where the packages and its info will be read. This directory should contain a pool and dists pair of trees.

key.name: pocket
key.description: The pocket where this import should go. A "pocket" is a sub-archive for a distribution release. The default pocket is called "release", others are "security", "updates" and "proposed". There may be more. Packages can be published in a specific pocket after the release is made, before that they will always be published in the "release" pocket.
key.metadefault: The "release" pocket is where packages are published before release.

key.name: pocketrelease
key.description: The distrorelease name to where packages should be published when working with pockets. Thats because on debian model hoary-updates can be seen as another distrorelease but it does not happens on launchpad.

key.name: katie_dbname
key.description: The Katie database that should be used to extract extra information from.

key.name: source_only
key.description: If true, only the source packages are imported and the binary packages ignored.

key.name: sourcepackagenames_only
key.description: If true, only the source package names are imported into Launchpad

key.name: dbuser
key.description: The database user wich will be used to make the package imports.

key.name: upload_port
key.description: Port number Librarian listens for storage requests on

key.name: download_port
key.description: Port number Librarian listens for HTTP GET and HEAD requests on

key.name: upload_host
key.description: Host Librarian is listening on for storage requests

key.name: download_host
key.description: Host Librarian is listening on for HTTP requests

key.name: download_url
key.description: The base URL used to generate URLs to the Library contents. Note that this might be on a different host or port to what is specified above if access to the Library is via Apache redirects.

key.name: buildd_download_url
key.description: The base URL used to generate URLs to the Library contents when passing URLs to the build daemons. This is likely to be a different host and port to the download url provided to external clients and is also likely to be proxied via Apache.

sectiontype.name: zopeless
sectiontype.description: Clusters zopeless specific configuration. Ideally, this section will disappear as Zope3 land and Python land grow closer

sectiontype.name: gpghandler
sectiontype.description: This utility is resposible for GPG operations like: sign/verify and encrypt/decrypt. it needs a "home" to allocate the runtime build configuration file and keyring and an addresss, "host:port", pointing a reliable keyserver.

key.name: host
key.description: Host running PKS-like (SKS) keyserver Application.

key.name: port
key.description: Port number on Host to access the keyserver

sectiontype.name: zeca
sectiontype.description: Stubed Key server for test proposes, it's able to server in SKS fortmat, a restricted set of keys. (fixed address at localhost:11371)

key.name: root
key.description: Directory to be created to store the pre-installed key-files

key.name: cache_path
key.description: Location on disk to store the visited URL cache, used to avoid utterly killing remote sites each time and play nice with the world.

key.name: dbuser
key.description: The database user wich will be used to update the karmacache table.

key.name: port
key.description: Port number Trebuchet listens for XML-RPC requests on.
